title: areYouLate() â€” A Python-Powered Transit Assistant
description: A Python console-based assistant that decodes GTFS (General Transit Feed Specification) data to provide live bus arrivals, real-time vehicle locations, service alerts, and nearest stop information. Built as a personal milestone project to apply programming, systems, and web data skills from first-year Applied Computer Science at Dalhousie University.
shortDescription: A Python assistant to check live bus arrivals, locations, and service alerts using GTFS data.
alt: A bus speeding to its destination

title: Portfolio Site
description: A static page that showcases my latest projects. Built using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
alt: An image of a computer screen with code

title: Blender Render Utilities - A Blender addon
description: A Blender addon that provides quick access to resolution presets for different screen ratios and platforms. This tool simplifies setting up render resolutions for social media content, filmmaking, and custom aspect ratios, making it easier for creators to maintain consistency across various formats.
shortDescription: A Blender addon that provides a quick and easy way to set render resolution presets for different screen ratios.
alt: A 3d render of a car on a bridge at sunset

title: Summer Research @ Vertex Lab
description: I was awarded an Undergraduate Student Research Award (USRA) by the Faculty of Computer Science and the Imhotep Legacy Academy. My Research looks at "How Users Interact with 3D Virtual Spaces and How UI Design Influences Perception"
shortDescription: ILA-USRA research on user interaction and perception in 3D virtual spaces.

title: Nia: A Black Youth Led Summit
description: An empowering summit organized by and for Black youth, focusing on leadership, community engagement, cultural celebration, and creating spaces for Black voices to thrive.
shortDescription: A youth-led summit fostering Black leadership, empowerment, and community connection.
